26556514.projn:
ID-Community Based Settlement Rehabilitation
            For Yogyajarta -- P103457
26556514.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
26556514.trustfund:
TF058077-BANK PROJECT APPRAISAL AND
            SUPERVISION FOR JAVA RECONSTRUCTION FUND,TF090014-COMMUNITY-BASED SETTLEMENT
            REHABILITATION AND RECONSTRUCTION PROJECT FO

repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Community-Based Settlement
            Rehabilitation and Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Community-Based
            Settlement Rehabilitation and Reconstruction Project for
            Indonesia were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk
            to development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: existing community-driven
            development (CDD) projects can be effectively utilized at
            short notice to respond to impacts of natural disasters.
            Housing grants are cost-effective when only covering the
            cost of the core structure. This encouraged communities to
            salvage materials (thereby re-using debris of the natural
            disaster), and contribute their own resources to the
            finishing of their homes. Reconstruction projects need to be
            linked to livelihood programs under coordination of local
            governments. Community settlement plans (CSPs) are no longer
            used to plan for disaster recovery, but have evolved as a
            tool for medium-term planning at the local government level.
            In many villages covered by the project, CSPs are now used
            as a reference in annual planning meetings. Local government
            involvement is essential to help prevent persons from
            returning to disaster risk areas. Post-disaster
            reconstruction is an opportunity to build community
            awareness and increased resilience toward disaster risk
            reduction (DRR).
